queryResult.queryText: how should i pay the bond
queryResult.fulfillmentText: [Source: Residential Tenancies Act 1986, ss 19-21, 109] The landlord has to give you a receipt for the bond and pay the bond over to Tenancy Services within 23 working days. If they don’t pay it over to Tenancy Services, the Tenancy Tribunal could order your landlord to pay you a penalty of up to $1000. Alternatively, you can pay your bond directly to Tenancy Services, if the landlord agrees to this. You and the landlord must both sign a bond lodgement form, which is sent to Tenancy Services with the bond money. You both should get a receipt from Tenancy Services around a week after they receive the money.

text:
[Source: Residential Tenancies Act 1986, ss 19-21, 109]
The landlord has to give you a receipt for the bond and pay the bond over to Tenancy Services within 23 working days. If they don’t pay it over to Tenancy Services, the Tenancy Tribunal could order your landlord to pay you a penalty of up to $1000. Alternatively, you can pay your bond directly to Tenancy Services, if the landlord agrees to this.
You and the landlord must both sign a bond lodgement form, which is sent to Tenancy Services with the bond money. You both should get a receipt from Tenancy Services around a week after they receive the money.
